message: This is an article about a campaign I truly believe in and support to end software patents forever. In reality, I want to abolish the patent system as a whole. Check it out
story: Muhammad Al Rabbani shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: End Software Patents | *** NEW CAMPAIGN *** launching August 2015! Interested? Email...
caption: endsoftpatents.org
description: Each software patent blocks software developers from implementing a feature such as a video format, pinch-to-zoom, or nested menus. For 20 years, no developer can implement that feature without asking the patent holder, who can refuse, or ask for payment and impose conditions. Today there are tens oâ€¦

data.message: Not fair :) I think the patents should last for sometime not for ever, but it's existence is mandatory especially if you have a small company.
No ya Ibraheem Osama Mohamed I disagree with you :)
Anyway, read the article, I think that more innovation will come when we are all free to innovate. I also believe that our ideas are not our own, but that is a long philosophical discussion

Let's imagine this scenario :) you've a small company and you had an idea and you start working on it and once you published a product or a service a very big company like MS or Google developed a similar product and for sure big companies have a better marketing and a better technical implementation team, the result will be everyone is using the famous better implemented one rather than the real one (Imagine years of effort by your side) :)

Nice scenario, but take for example the Linux Kernel and the Gnu OS, it was more stable and better performing than Windows, and I can argue that it still is, yet MS does not copy it because it is bound by the license. The idea behind free software is that those that copy it, cannot sell the actual product for money, they can only sell the support and their code must be open for all to see :)

So you write a great app under the GNU public license, I take the app, refine it, make it better, but I cannot close source it, I must make it freely available for all people, including you :) Free as in freedom not free beer :D
please also check out this website https://www.fsf.org/

I believe in openness but also everyone is free to decide whether he wants to open his software or not :) also I'm will never blame a company for thinking in a profitable way ;) one last think I learned a lot from the open source software and that's the main reason I support it but sometimes you need close your door to survive.

Profitable is very good and also very important, but you can be profitable because you are creative, or because you provide better service. There are many companies that are making money off of free software. In fact the trend is for Open Source to take over and Shrink the market turning it into a services market...

To make things clear, I am not talking about forcing openness, but I believe companies will do that anyway, as you can see from the market, as the price of software now trends to Zero :)
